definition: Baruch or Benedict Spinoza (1632-1677), rationalist philosopher
Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]
see 莎草[suo1 cao3]/see 摩莎[mo2 suo1]

sentences.english: A second difference between Harvey's perspective and ours would seem to center on the figure of Baruch Spinoza.
sentences.chinese: 哈維與我們的第二個差別看起來是關於斯賓諾莎的。

sentences.english: Chapter 1 of text is concerning the source of the natural law theory of the Spinoza of.
sentences.chinese: 正文的第一章是關於斯賓諾莎自然法學說的來源問題。

sentences.english: Spinoza argued that the democratic system was the best of all the forms of government.
sentences.chinese: 斯賓諾莎認爲，民主政體是最好的治理國家的方式。

sentences.english: About the former Spinoza and Einstein are well-known examples.
sentences.chinese: 斯賓諾莎和愛因斯坦就是猶太人中著名的例子。

sentences.english: Rationalists are Descartes, Leibniz and Spinoza.
sentences.chinese: 理性主義者有笛卡爾，萊布尼茲和斯賓諾莎。
